@Kinetograph I have a serious doubt on this film and it's probably a fault in the plot.
@Kinetograph William got an education. Arrived back home with his college degree and then the minister chooses William to replace him.
@Kinetograph Yes, terrible thing. The wife's character was also measured up to the fact that she couldn't handle the house work well.
@miwi1010 Yes, it appears we're supposed to think that wives should stay locked up at home in service to their husbands.
@Kinetograph Another chauvinistic plot. But, when it comes to Griffith, I'm even used to that.
@Kinetograph No wonder I dont remember to have ever seen her in any other film.
@miwi1010 It's also noteworthy for its early use of "follow focus."
@Kinetograph That was different even compared with the usual plots of Griffith's films.
@miwi1010 Yes, you're correct.
